title: Deadliest Russian Attack in Months on Ukraine’s Cities Kills at Least 25
description: The first widespread barrage on civilian targets in more than a month underscored the vital role of Ukrainian air defenses.

title: E.U. Extends Tariff Waiver for Ukrainian Grain, Despite Some Protests
description: The bloc will provide more than $100 million to farmers in eastern countries where tariff-free Ukrainian grain produced a supply glut and plunging prices.

title: Spain Bakes in Summer-Like Heat, and Worries About What Comes Next
description: The April temperatures, over 100 degrees Fahrenheit in some places, come on top of a long-running drought that has depleted reservoirs and dried up fields.

title: Mother in Uman Holds Out Hope Her Children Will Be Found After Russian Attack
description: A Russian rocket slammed into a nine-story apartment building before dawn in the central Ukrainian city of Uman.

title: Man Who Has Fathered Hundreds Is Barred From Donating Sperm
description: A court in the Netherlands ruled that a man who fathered at least 550 children in the past 16 years had lied to prospective mothers and fertility clinics.

title: Cease-Fire Is Extended in Sudan, but Bombardments and Gunfire Ensue
description: As the clashes entered the 14th day, foreign powers continued evacuating their nationals as they warned of escalating violence in the coming days.

title: Pranksters posed as Zelensky in a call with the Federal Reserve chairman.
A More Climate-Resistant Coffee Rises in Africa
description: As global warming threatens two popular species, growers in Uganda are betting on a variety that can stand up to heat, drought and pests.

title: What I’m Reading: Wives and Muses Edition
description: A look at women who inspired great art and literature and what might have been.

title: Italian Tourism Campaign With Botticelli’s Venus Faces Backlash
description: An initiative featuring a computerized version of Botticelli’s Venus aims to bolster tourism, but it has been roundly mocked in Italy for using stereotypes about the country.

title: EU Extends Tariff-Free Ukraine Grain Policy, Despite Protests
description: Five countries whose farmers have been hurt by the policy, including Poland, will get carve-outs and compensation, under an agreement reached Friday.

title: Australia Eyes a Fraught Pivot from Coal Power to Renewables
description: As the country’s oldest power station closed, experts warn that the country needs a clearer strategy to manage its exit from coal power.

title: Large-Scale Russian Attack on Ukraine Kills at Least 16 People
description: Russia bombarded towns and cities across the country in its first major attack in more than a month.

title: The Long Shadow of Covid School Closures
description: Long school closures have put public education — and Randi Weingarten, the leader of a major teachers’ union — on the defensive.

title: BBC Chairman Resigns, Deepening Turmoil at UK’s Broadcaster
description: Richard Sharp stepped down after an investigation concluded that he improperly failed to disclose his involvement in arranging a loan for the former prime minister, Boris Johnson.

title: Germans Protect Memorials to Soviet Troops Who Defeated Nazis
description: Such monuments have been toppled across Eastern Europe, particularly since Russia invaded Ukraine. But in Germany, they are seen as a way to honor Nazi victims and grapple with history.

title: For Founders of Small Businesses, the Personal Story Matters
description: A business owner’s personal story can bolster trust in a brand, experts say. But what happens when they share hardships like homelessness, addiction or incarceration in company marketing?

title: The Shining Promise and Dashed Dreams of China’s Live Shopping Craze
description: Star sellers can amass huge followings and eye-popping fortunes, through a format that mixes consumerism and entertainment. But competition is fierce, and the government is watching.

title: ‘Lord Commander’ of the DMZ Has Seen It All on the Korean Frontier
description: He faced off with North Korean troops, helped prepare for the Trump-Kim summit and witnessed some of the most ​hair-raising — and ​bizarre — moments ​on the world’s most heavily armed border.

title: Pope Returns to Hungary, to Delight of Viktor Orban
description: Francis wants to “re-embrace” Hungarian Christians, but some worry the visit gives political cover to the country’s leader, who is on the opposite side of nearly every issue important to the pontiff.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Dark projections for Russia’s energy industry.

title: What British Royal Moments Resonated With You?
description: We’re asking readers about the moments that changed how they view the royals, ahead of King Charles’s coronation.
